1.definition: trying something to find out about it
examples: a sample for ten days free trial
a trial of progesterone failed to relieve the pain

2.definition: any standardized procedure for measuring sensitivity or memory or intelligence or aptitude or personality etc
examples: the test was standardized on a large sample of students

3.definition: a set of questions or exercises evaluating skill or knowledge
examples: when the test was stolen the professor had to make a new set of questions
candidates must compete in a trial of skill
he survived the great test of battle
in the experimental trials the amount of carbon was measured separately
he called each flip of the coin a new trial

6.definition: a hard outer covering as of some amoebas and sea urchins

7.definition: put to the test, as for its quality, or give experimental use to
examples: This approach has been tried with good results

8.definition: test or examine for the presence of disease or infection
examples: screen the blood for the HIV virus
The teacher tests us every week
We got quizzed on French irregular verbs

10.definition: show a certain characteristic when tested

11.definition: achieve a certain score or rating on a test
examples: She tested high on the LSAT and was admitted to all the good law schools

12.definition: determine the presence or properties of (a substance)
